intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. apertiformis, commonly known as the golden buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are deeply lobed and have a distinctive, almost fern-like appearance. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in early spring.
